programme.title: Criminals: Caught on Camera
programme.desc:
Journalist Nick Wallis joins police forces across the country to reveal how CCTV and technological advances are helping to ensure convictions against shoplifters. The programme reveals how essential surveillance cameras have become in the fight against crime and features footage of people caught red-handed
S02E02

programme.title: Police Interceptors
programme.desc:
Officers hunt for two suspects allegedly armed with a gun after a tram-stop robbery in Bulwell. Dan Machin and Jim Campin spot a pair who fit the description, but the suspects vanish over a railway footbridge, unaware that on the other side of the tracks firearms cops Lenny and Paul are closing in. Plus, Jim and Ben respond to a report of teenagers on the rampage in the market town of Arnold
S19E14

programme.title: Police Interceptors
programme.desc:
Documentary following the work of elite crime-fighting units, this time riding along with officers covering the West Yorkshire region. In the first edition, Jo and Mike track down a VW Golf that was involved in a robbery to a petrol station, but as they try to stop the driver, the fleeing car slams into Jo and then smashes through the pumps in a desperate bid to escape
S15E01

programme.title: Police Interceptors
programme.desc:
In Mansfield, Phil Broughton goes undercover to find a man who is fresh on the wanted list, and Lisa and Jim stop a dodgy driver outside Nottingham railway station. Elsewhere, the knife crime team prove their interceptor intuition is on the button as they stop a red light runner with a thing or two to hidden in his car
S20E07

programme.title: Police Interceptors
programme.desc:
Dog handler James 'Coups' Coupland chases down a boy racer in a Skoda on a dual carriageway. A young man is pulled over in a Vauxhall that is suspected of having cloned plates, and officers Lewis and Paul are dispatched to reign in a runaway shire horse on the A453
S20E11

programme.title: The Four Horsemen of the Apocalypse (1961)
programme.desc: An Argentinian tycoon's family is torn apart when one grandson becomes a Nazi and the other fights for the French Resistance. Second World War drama, starring Glenn Ford, Ingrid Thulin, Charles Boyer and Lee J Cobb

programme.title: Ben-Hur (1959)
programme.desc: A Jewish prince in first-century Jerusalem is reunited with an old Roman friend, who is now the governor of Judea. However, their differing political views over local dissent leads to a bitter quarrel, and the governor uses the pretext of an accident to sell him into slavery and imprison his mother and sister. Years later, the prince returns, determined to seek revenge and find his missing family. Oscar-winning epic, starring Charlton Heston, Stephen Boyd and Haya Harareet

programme.title: The Dead Pool (1988)
programme.desc: Uncompromising detective 'Dirty' Harry Callahan hunts the ringleaders behind a bizarre death lottery which is seemingly being used to murder well-known figures. The case becomes personal when he discovers his own name is on the list of prospective victims. Action thriller sequel, starring Clint Eastwood, Patricia Clarkson, Liam Neeson and an early appearance by Jim Carrey

programme.title: Raid on Entebbe (1977)
programme.desc: Fact-based drama recounting the Israeli raid on Uganda's Entebbe airport, where more than 100 passengers were being held hostage on board a hijacked airliner in 1976. As the world waits, the authorities launch a daring operation to free the prisoners. Starring Peter Finch, Martin Balsam, Horst Buchholz, Jack Warden and Sylvia Sidney

programme.title: Dances with Wolves (1990)
programme.desc: A Union army officer during the American Civil War requests a posting to a remote outpost on the frontier. Left to man a deserted fort single-handedly, he is gradually adopted into a local Sioux tribe - but they are endangered when his former comrades come looking for him. Oscar-winning Western, directed by and starring Kevin Costner. With Mary McDonnell, Graham Greene, Rodney A Grant and Floyd Red Crow Westerman

programme.title: HMP Wakefield: Evil Behind Bars
programme.desc: Through interviews with ex-inmates, retired guards and relatives of Britain's most infamous inmates, this documentary uncover secrets of life inside one of the UK's toughest jails. Exclusive phone calls from one of the UK's longest-serving inmates, Charles Bronson, reveal first-hand what life is really like as inmate in Wakefield Prison, and there are never-before-told stories from inside the walls of Wakefield about Jeremy Bamber, arguably as famous for his fight to get out of prison as for the crimes he committed to be sent there

programme.title: Banged Up: HMP Frankland
programme.desc: Documentary exploring life inside HMP Frankland, the men's maximum security prison in County Durham, which has housed some of the country's most notorious criminals, including Peter Sutcliffe, Ian Huntley and Delroy Grant. The programme recounts some of the violent prison attacks that have taken place over the years, including one so horrifying that it forced a staff member to retire. Later, an ex-prisoner shares how he passed the time in Frankland's segregation unit by organising a quiz through the cell windows

programme.title: Springwatch: Spring’s Natural Revelations
programme.desc: Spring is a season of new life and hopefulness, when anything seems possible in the longer days ahead. It can be the most dramatic, expectant and optimistic of seasons when our trees and hedgerows display leaves of every shade of green, wildflowers burst into life in our hay meadows, and blossom festoons our orchards. Our wildlife has a spring in its step too as lives are consumed with mating, hatching and survival. Springwatch has been filming the very best wildlife with unique stories to tell

Our wildlife has a spring in its step too as lives are consumed with mating, hatching and survival. Springwatch has been filming the very best wildlife with unique stories to tell

Our wildlife has a spring in its step too as lives are consumed with mating, hatching and survival. Springwatch has been filming the very best wildlife with unique stories to tell

It can be the most dramatic, expectant and optimistic of seasons when our trees and hedgerows display leaves of every shade of green, wildflowers burst into life in our hay meadows, and blossom festoons our orchards. Our wildlife has a spring in its step too as lives are consumed with mating, hatching and survival. Springwatch has been filming the very best wildlife with unique stories to tell

Our wildlife has a spring in its step too as lives are consumed with mating, hatching and survival. Springwatch has been filming the very best wildlife with unique stories to tell

programme.desc: Spring is a season of new life and hopefulness, when anything seems possible in the longer days ahead. It can be the most dramatic, expectant and optimistic of seasons when our trees and hedgerows display leaves of every shade of green, wildflowers burst into life in our hay meadows, and blossom festoons our orchards. Our wildlife has a spring in its step too as lives are consumed with mating, hatching and survival. Springwatch has been filming the very best wildlife with unique stories to tell

programme.desc:

In the Amazon, a female spider monkey elder leads its troop to aquatic plants brought within reach on raging floodwaters and shows them how they can feast on this unlikely bounty by using their remarkable tails as safety ropes

programme.title: Countryfile
programme.desc:
Upper Teesdale: Charlotte Smith and Matt Baker travel to Upper Teesdale in the Durham Dales, where Charlotte meets 97-year-old botanist Dr Margaret Bradshaw, who for the past 70 years has been at the forefront of classifying, surveying and protecting the rare flora of Widdybank Fell. Matt joins members of the Durham Wildlife Trust as they survey endangered ground nesting wading birds by using sound monitoring posts that can distinguish calls from individual species and calculate how many birds are in the area
S2023E22

programme.title: Antiques Roadshow
programme.desc:
Powis Castle & Garden, Welshpool 1: Fiona Bruce visits Powis Castle, one of the grandest houses in Wales, where Duncan Campbell discovers a vanishingly rare silver tobacco box from the 1600s, and Serhat Ahmet examines a porcelain egg with a royal connection. Paul Atterbury is taken back to the earliest days of Dr Who, while Alexandra Aguilar values a jade ornament bought at a car boot sale for 50 pence and Geoffrey Munn uncovers a jewellery collection 'of the highest quality' with rubies and diamonds dating from the 1700s

This is their very last chance to pull out all the stops, show everything they've learned along the way and demonstrate the kind of cook they have become. programme.title: Who Do You Think You Are?
programme.desc:
Andrew Lloyd Webber: Composer Andrew Lloyd Webber knows he comes from a musical family, including virtuoso cellist brother Julian, but he is curious as to where his showbusiness genes and love of musical theatre come from. By following his mother's line, Andrew soon uncovers a certain Uncle Peregrine, who played a key role under Wellington at the Battle of Waterloo. On his father's side, Henry Simmonds was a missionary who dedicated his life to helping the poor and needy. Andrew is astonished to uncover stories that uncannily parallel his own life, including an ancestor with a famous cello-playing brother
S20E01

programme.title: Lifeline
programme.desc: Owain Wyn Evans makes an appeal on behalf of Melanoma Focus, a charity supporting patients and carers, as well as funding specialist skin cancer research across the UK

programme.title: Alice Through the Looking Glass (2016)
programme.desc: Alice Kingsleigh has spent three years sailing the high seas. Upon her return to London from China, she returns to the magical world of Underland and takes a journey back in time to save the Mad Hatter and her friends. Fantasy adventure sequel, starring Mia Wasikowska, Johnny Depp and Anne Hathaway

programme.title: Primates
programme.desc:
Family Matters: Chris Packham narrates a look at the complex social and family lives of the animal group, including leaf monkeys competing to babysit a bright orange infant and rally to defend it from a python, and gibbons learning daredevil treetop acrobatics with their playmates. In the Amazon, a female spider monkey elder leads its troop to aquatic plants brought within reach on raging floodwaters and shows them how they can feast on this unlikely bounty by using their remarkable tails as safety ropes
S01E02

programme.title: Final Score
programme.desc: Jason Mohammad presents a round-up of the results and this afternoon's news from the final day of the Premier League season

programme.title: Spotlight
programme.desc: News/Current Affairs

programme.title: Weather
programme.desc: Preview of the UK's weather

programme.title: Countryfile
programme.desc:
Upper Teesdale: Charlotte Smith and Matt Baker travel to Upper Teesdale in the Durham Dales, where Charlotte meets 97-year-old botanist Dr Margaret Bradshaw, who for the past 70 years has been at the forefront of classifying, surveying and protecting the rare flora of Widdybank Fell. Matt joins members of the Durham Wildlife Trust as they survey endangered ground nesting wading birds by using sound monitoring posts that can distinguish calls from individual species and calculate how many birds are in the area
S2023E22

programme.title: Antiques Roadshow
programme.desc:
Powis Castle & Garden, Welshpool 1: Fiona Bruce visits Powis Castle, one of the grandest houses in Wales, where Duncan Campbell discovers a vanishingly rare silver tobacco box from the 1600s, and Serhat Ahmet examines a porcelain egg with a royal connection. Paul Atterbury is taken back to the earliest days of Dr Who, while Alexandra Aguilar values a jade ornament bought at a car boot sale for 50 pence and Geoffrey Munn uncovers a jewellery collection 'of the highest quality' with rubies and diamonds dating from the 1700s
S45E15

S01E03

programme.title: MasterChef
programme.desc:
After an arduous eight-week journey, the search for the country's best amateur cook reaches its climax as the final contenders push themselves to the limit for one last time before judges John Torode and Gregg Wallace. This is their very last chance to pull out all the stops, show everything they've learned along the way and demonstrate the kind of cook they have become. They must produce the best three dishes of their lives, push their culinary boundaries and deliver jaw-droppingly good food as they vie to lift the trophy and become the 19th MasterChef champion
S19E24

programme.title: Who Do You Think You Are?
programme.desc:
Andrew Lloyd Webber: Composer Andrew Lloyd Webber knows he comes from a musical family, including virtuoso cellist brother Julian, but he is curious as to where his showbusiness genes and love of musical theatre come from. By following his mother's line, Andrew soon uncovers a certain Uncle Peregrine, who played a key role under Wellington at the Battle of Waterloo. On his father's side, Henry Simmonds was a missionary who dedicated his life to helping the poor and needy. Andrew is astonished to uncover stories that uncannily parallel his own life, including an ancestor with a famous cello-playing brother
S20E01

programme.desc: Manchester City v Manchester United (Kick-off 3.00pm). Gary Lineker presents coverage of the final from Wembley Stadium, as the local rivals battle it out for the prestigious trophy. Premier League-winners City claimed a 3-0 win over Championship side Sheffield United in the semi-finals, before United overcame Brighton & Hove Albion on penalties to reach their second Wembley final of the campaign, having already lifted the Carabao Cup. The Citizens prevailed 6-3 when the neighbours met in the league in October at Etihad Stadium, but United gained a measure of revenge with a 2-1 victory at Old Trafford three months later. Into this melting pot is thrust well-intentioned inspector John Kildare, who has never been given a murder case before. The Scotland Yard sleuth knows he has been set up to fail, but soon uncovers a lead that implicates Karl Marx, George Gissing and the popular music hall star Dan Leno. programme.title: MasterChef
programme.desc:
After an arduous eight-week journey, the search for the country's best amateur cook reaches its climax as the final contenders push themselves to the limit for one last time before judges John Torode and Gregg Wallace. This is their very last chance to pull out all the stops, show everything they've learned along the way and demonstrate the kind of cook they have become. They must produce the best three dishes of their lives, push their culinary boundaries and deliver jaw-droppingly good food as they vie to lift the trophy and become the 19th MasterChef champion

programme.title: Who Do You Think You Are?
programme.desc:
Andrew Lloyd Webber: Composer Andrew Lloyd Webber knows he comes from a musical family, including virtuoso cellist brother Julian, but he is curious as to where his showbusiness genes and love of musical theatre come from. By following his mother's line, Andrew soon uncovers a certain Uncle Peregrine, who played a key role under Wellington at the Battle of Waterloo. On his father's side, Henry Simmonds was a missionary who dedicated his life to helping the poor and needy. Andrew is astonished to uncover stories that uncannily parallel his own life, including an ancestor with a famous cello-playing brother
S20E01

programme.desc: Manchester City v Manchester United (Kick-off 3.00pm). Gary Lineker presents coverage of the final from Wembley Stadium, as the local rivals battle it out for the prestigious trophy. Premier League-winners City claimed a 3-0 win over Championship side Sheffield United in the semi-finals, before United overcame Brighton & Hove Albion on penalties to reach their second Wembley final of the campaign, having already lifted the Carabao Cup. The Citizens prevailed 6-3 when the neighbours met in the league in October at Etihad Stadium, but United gained a measure of revenge with a 2-1 victory at Old Trafford three months later. Paul Atterbury is taken back to the earliest days of Dr Who, while Alexandra Aguilar values a jade ornament bought at a car boot sale for 50 pence and Geoffrey Munn uncovers a jewellery collection 'of the highest quality' with rubies and diamonds dating from the 1700s

programme.title: Who Do You Think You Are?
programme.desc:
Andrew Lloyd Webber: Composer Andrew Lloyd Webber knows he comes from a musical family, including virtuoso cellist brother Julian, but he is curious as to where his showbusiness genes and love of musical theatre come from. By following his mother's line, Andrew soon uncovers a certain Uncle Peregrine, who played a key role under Wellington at the Battle of Waterloo. On his father's side, Henry Simmonds was a missionary who dedicated his life to helping the poor and needy. Andrew is astonished to uncover stories that uncannily parallel his own life, including an ancestor with a famous cello-playing brother

programme.desc: Manchester City v Manchester United (Kick-off 3.00pm). Gary Lineker presents coverage of the final from Wembley Stadium, as the local rivals battle it out for the prestigious trophy. Premier League-winners City claimed a 3-0 win over Championship side Sheffield United in the semi-finals, before United overcame Brighton & Hove Albion on penalties to reach their second Wembley final of the campaign, having already lifted the Carabao Cup. The Citizens prevailed 6-3 when the neighbours met in the league in October at Etihad Stadium, but United gained a measure of revenge with a 2-1 victory at Old Trafford three months later. By following his mother's line, Andrew soon uncovers a certain Uncle Peregrine, who played a key role under Wellington at the Battle of Waterloo. On his father's side, Henry Simmonds was a missionary who dedicated his life to helping the poor and needy. Andrew is astonished to uncover stories that uncannily parallel his own life, including an ancestor with a famous cello-playing brother

programme.desc: After a series of violent murders scandalises Victorian London, the media-dubbed Limehouse Golem strikes fear into the hearts of the public. Into this melting pot is thrust well-intentioned inspector John Kildare, who has never been given a murder case before. The Scotland Yard sleuth knows he has been set up to fail, but soon uncovers a lead that implicates Karl Marx, George Gissing and the popular music hall star Dan Leno. He follows the trail, wherever it may lead, through the seediest and most intriguing parts of London. Thriller, starring Bill Nighy, Douglas Booth and Olivia Cooke

programme.desc:

Matt joins members of the Durham Wildlife Trust as they survey endangered ground nesting wading birds by using sound monitoring posts that can distinguish calls from individual species and calculate how many birds are in the area

Paul Atterbury is taken back to the earliest days of Dr Who, while Alexandra Aguilar values a jade ornament bought at a car boot sale for 50 pence and Geoffrey Munn uncovers a jewellery collection 'of the highest quality' with rubies and diamonds dating from the 1700s

programme.desc:
After an arduous eight-week journey, the search for the country's best amateur cook reaches its climax as the final contenders push themselves to the limit for one last time before judges John Torode and Gregg Wallace. This is their very last chance to pull out all the stops, show everything they've learned along the way and demonstrate the kind of cook they have become. programme.title: Who Do You Think You Are?
programme.desc:
Andrew Lloyd Webber: Composer Andrew Lloyd Webber knows he comes from a musical family, including virtuoso cellist brother Julian, but he is curious as to where his showbusiness genes and love of musical theatre come from. By following his mother's line, Andrew soon uncovers a certain Uncle Peregrine, who played a key role under Wellington at the Battle of Waterloo. On his father's side, Henry Simmonds was a missionary who dedicated his life to helping the poor and needy. Andrew is astonished to uncover stories that uncannily parallel his own life, including an ancestor with a famous cello-playing brother
S20E01

Premier League-winners City claimed a 3-0 win over Championship side Sheffield United in the semi-finals, before United overcame Brighton & Hove Albion on penalties to reach their second Wembley final of the campaign, having already lifted the Carabao Cup. The Citizens prevailed 6-3 when the neighbours met in the league in October at Etihad Stadium, but United gained a measure of revenge with a 2-1 victory at Old Trafford three months later. This is their very last chance to pull out all the stops, show everything they've learned along the way and demonstrate the kind of cook they have become. programme.title: Who Do You Think You Are?
programme.desc:
Andrew Lloyd Webber: Composer Andrew Lloyd Webber knows he comes from a musical family, including virtuoso cellist brother Julian, but he is curious as to where his showbusiness genes and love of musical theatre come from. By following his mother's line, Andrew soon uncovers a certain Uncle Peregrine, who played a key role under Wellington at the Battle of Waterloo. On his father's side, Henry Simmonds was a missionary who dedicated his life to helping the poor and needy. Andrew is astonished to uncover stories that uncannily parallel his own life, including an ancestor with a famous cello-playing brother
S20E01

programme.desc: Manchester City v Manchester United (Kick-off 3.00pm). Gary Lineker presents coverage of the final from Wembley Stadium, as the local rivals battle it out for the prestigious trophy. Premier League-winners City claimed a 3-0 win over Championship side Sheffield United in the semi-finals, before United overcame Brighton & Hove Albion on penalties to reach their second Wembley final of the campaign, having already lifted the Carabao Cup. The Citizens prevailed 6-3 when the neighbours met in the league in October at Etihad Stadium, but United gained a measure of revenge with a 2-1 victory at Old Trafford three months later. programme.desc: After a series of violent murders scandalises Victorian London, the media-dubbed Limehouse Golem strikes fear into the hearts of the public. Into this melting pot is thrust well-intentioned inspector John Kildare, who has never been given a murder case before. The Scotland Yard sleuth knows he has been set up to fail, but soon uncovers a lead that implicates Karl Marx, George Gissing and the popular music hall star Dan Leno. He follows the trail, wherever it may lead, through the seediest and most intriguing parts of London. Thriller, starring Bill Nighy, Douglas Booth and Olivia Cooke

programme.desc:
After an arduous eight-week journey, the search for the country's best amateur cook reaches its climax as the final contenders push themselves to the limit for one last time before judges John Torode and Gregg Wallace. This is their very last chance to pull out all the stops, show everything they've learned along the way and demonstrate the kind of cook they have become. They must produce the best three dishes of their lives, push their culinary boundaries and deliver jaw-droppingly good food as they vie to lift the trophy and become the 19th MasterChef champion

programme.title: Who Do You Think You Are?
programme.desc:
Andrew Lloyd Webber: Composer Andrew Lloyd Webber knows he comes from a musical family, including virtuoso cellist brother Julian, but he is curious as to where his showbusiness genes and love of musical theatre come from. By following his mother's line, Andrew soon uncovers a certain Uncle Peregrine, who played a key role under Wellington at the Battle of Waterloo. On his father's side, Henry Simmonds was a missionary who dedicated his life to helping the poor and needy. Andrew is astonished to uncover stories that uncannily parallel his own life, including an ancestor with a famous cello-playing brother
S20E01

Premier League-winners City claimed a 3-0 win over Championship side Sheffield United in the semi-finals, before United overcame Brighton & Hove Albion on penalties to reach their second Wembley final of the campaign, having already lifted the Carabao Cup. The Citizens prevailed 6-3 when the neighbours met in the league in October at Etihad Stadium, but United gained a measure of revenge with a 2-1 victory at Old Trafford three months later. Upper Teesdale: Charlotte Smith and Matt Baker travel to Upper Teesdale in the Durham Dales, where Charlotte meets 97-year-old botanist Dr Margaret Bradshaw, who for the past 70 years has been at the forefront of classifying, surveying and protecting the rare flora of Widdybank Fell. Matt joins members of the Durham Wildlife Trust as they survey endangered ground nesting wading birds by using sound monitoring posts that can distinguish calls from individual species and calculate how many birds are in the area
S2023E22

programme.title: Antiques Roadshow
programme.desc:
Powis Castle & Garden, Welshpool 1: Fiona Bruce visits Powis Castle, one of the grandest houses in Wales, where Duncan Campbell discovers a vanishingly rare silver tobacco box from the 1600s, and Serhat Ahmet examines a porcelain egg with a royal connection. Paul Atterbury is taken back to the earliest days of Dr Who, while Alexandra Aguilar values a jade ornament bought at a car boot sale for 50 pence and Geoffrey Munn uncovers a jewellery collection 'of the highest quality' with rubies and diamonds dating from the 1700s
S45E15

programme.desc:

This is their very last chance to pull out all the stops, show everything they've learned along the way and demonstrate the kind of cook they have become. programme.title: Who Do You Think You Are?
programme.desc:
Andrew Lloyd Webber: Composer Andrew Lloyd Webber knows he comes from a musical family, including virtuoso cellist brother Julian, but he is curious as to where his showbusiness genes and love of musical theatre come from. By following his mother's line, Andrew soon uncovers a certain Uncle Peregrine, who played a key role under Wellington at the Battle of Waterloo. On his father's side, Henry Simmonds was a missionary who dedicated his life to helping the poor and needy. Andrew is astonished to uncover stories that uncannily parallel his own life, including an ancestor with a famous cello-playing brother
S20E01

programme.title: Our Lives
programme.desc: Cage fighting pro Stevie 'Braveheart' Ray is just one fight away from becoming Scotland's first world champion. This documentary captures the all-or-nothing tale of the lead-up to a major prize fight - and the aftermath - as told through the eyes of his wife Natalie, a 30-year-old mother of four. The PFL world championship is staged in Madison Square Gardens, New York, and the top prize is a million dollars. However, MMA can be dangerous, with fighters having only a pair of 4oz gloves for protection. Both physical pain and mental health are factors to be considered

programme.desc: Manchester City v Manchester United (Kick-off 3.00pm). Gary Lineker presents coverage of the final from Wembley Stadium, as the local rivals battle it out for the prestigious trophy. Premier League-winners City claimed a 3-0 win over Championship side Sheffield United in the semi-finals, before United overcame Brighton & Hove Albion on penalties to reach their second Wembley final of the campaign, having already lifted the Carabao Cup. The Citizens prevailed 6-3 when the neighbours met in the league in October at Etihad Stadium, but United gained a measure of revenge with a 2-1 victory at Old Trafford three months later. Into this melting pot is thrust well-intentioned inspector John Kildare, who has never been given a murder case before. The Scotland Yard sleuth knows he has been set up to fail, but soon uncovers a lead that implicates Karl Marx, George Gissing and the popular music hall star Dan Leno. programme.title: MasterChef
programme.desc:
After an arduous eight-week journey, the search for the country's best amateur cook reaches its climax as the final contenders push themselves to the limit for one last time before judges John Torode and Gregg Wallace. This is their very last chance to pull out all the stops, show everything they've learned along the way and demonstrate the kind of cook they have become. They must produce the best three dishes of their lives, push their culinary boundaries and deliver jaw-droppingly good food as they vie to lift the trophy and become the 19th MasterChef champion
S19E24

programme.title: Who Do You Think You Are?
programme.desc:
Andrew Lloyd Webber: Composer Andrew Lloyd Webber knows he comes from a musical family, including virtuoso cellist brother Julian, but he is curious as to where his showbusiness genes and love of musical theatre come from. By following his mother's line, Andrew soon uncovers a certain Uncle Peregrine, who played a key role under Wellington at the Battle of Waterloo. On his father's side, Henry Simmonds was a missionary who dedicated his life to helping the poor and needy. Andrew is astonished to uncover stories that uncannily parallel his own life, including an ancestor with a famous cello-playing brother
S20E01

programme.title: Match of the Day Live: The FA Cup
programme.desc: Manchester City v Manchester United (Kick-off 3.00pm). Gary Lineker presents coverage of the final from Wembley Stadium, as the local rivals battle it out for the prestigious trophy. Premier League-winners City claimed a 3-0 win over Championship side Sheffield United in the semi-finals, before United overcame Brighton & Hove Albion on penalties to reach their second Wembley final of the campaign, having already lifted the Carabao Cup. The Citizens prevailed 6-3 when the neighbours met in the league in October at Etihad Stadium, but United gained a measure of revenge with a 2-1 victory at Old Trafford three months later. This is their very last chance to pull out all the stops, show everything they've learned along the way and demonstrate the kind of cook they have become. programme.title: Who Do You Think You Are?
programme.desc:
Andrew Lloyd Webber: Composer Andrew Lloyd Webber knows he comes from a musical family, including virtuoso cellist brother Julian, but he is curious as to where his showbusiness genes and love of musical theatre come from. By following his mother's line, Andrew soon uncovers a certain Uncle Peregrine, who played a key role under Wellington at the Battle of Waterloo. On his father's side, Henry Simmonds was a missionary who dedicated his life to helping the poor and needy. Andrew is astonished to uncover stories that uncannily parallel his own life, including an ancestor with a famous cello-playing brother

Premier League-winners City claimed a 3-0 win over Championship side Sheffield United in the semi-finals, before United overcame Brighton & Hove Albion on penalties to reach their second Wembley final of the campaign, having already lifted the Carabao Cup. programme.desc:
Andrew Lloyd Webber: Composer Andrew Lloyd Webber knows he comes from a musical family, including virtuoso cellist brother Julian, but he is curious as to where his showbusiness genes and love of musical theatre come from. By following his mother's line, Andrew soon uncovers a certain Uncle Peregrine, who played a key role under Wellington at the Battle of Waterloo. On his father's side, Henry Simmonds was a missionary who dedicated his life to helping the poor and needy. Andrew is astonished to uncover stories that uncannily parallel his own life, including an ancestor with a famous cello-playing brother

programme.desc: Manchester City v Manchester United (Kick-off 3.00pm). Gary Lineker presents coverage of the final from Wembley Stadium, as the local rivals battle it out for the prestigious trophy. Premier League-winners City claimed a 3-0 win over Championship side Sheffield United in the semi-finals, before United overcame Brighton & Hove Albion on penalties to reach their second Wembley final of the campaign, having already lifted the Carabao Cup. Paul Atterbury is taken back to the earliest days of Dr Who, while Alexandra Aguilar values a jade ornament bought at a car boot sale for 50 pence and Geoffrey Munn uncovers a jewellery collection 'of the highest quality' with rubies and diamonds dating from the 1700s

This is their very last chance to pull out all the stops, show everything they've learned along the way and demonstrate the kind of cook they have become. programme.title: Who Do You Think You Are?
programme.desc:
Andrew Lloyd Webber: Composer Andrew Lloyd Webber knows he comes from a musical family, including virtuoso cellist brother Julian, but he is curious as to where his showbusiness genes and love of musical theatre come from. By following his mother's line, Andrew soon uncovers a certain Uncle Peregrine, who played a key role under Wellington at the Battle of Waterloo. On his father's side, Henry Simmonds was a missionary who dedicated his life to helping the poor and needy. Andrew is astonished to uncover stories that uncannily parallel his own life, including an ancestor with a famous cello-playing brother

programme.desc:
After an arduous eight-week journey, the search for the country's best amateur cook reaches its climax as the final contenders push themselves to the limit for one last time before judges John Torode and Gregg Wallace. This is their very last chance to pull out all the stops, show everything they've learned along the way and demonstrate the kind of cook they have become. programme.title: Who Do You Think You Are?
programme.desc:
Andrew Lloyd Webber: Composer Andrew Lloyd Webber knows he comes from a musical family, including virtuoso cellist brother Julian, but he is curious as to where his showbusiness genes and love of musical theatre come from. By following his mother's line, Andrew soon uncovers a certain Uncle Peregrine, who played a key role under Wellington at the Battle of Waterloo. On his father's side, Henry Simmonds was a missionary who dedicated his life to helping the poor and needy. Andrew is astonished to uncover stories that uncannily parallel his own life, including an ancestor with a famous cello-playing brother
S20E01

programme.title: Match of the Day Live: The FA Cup
programme.desc: Manchester City v Manchester United (Kick-off 3.00pm). Gary Lineker presents coverage of the final from Wembley Stadium, as the local rivals battle it out for the prestigious trophy. Premier League-winners City claimed a 3-0 win over Championship side Sheffield United in the semi-finals, before United overcame Brighton & Hove Albion on penalties to reach their second Wembley final of the campaign, having already lifted the Carabao Cup. The Citizens prevailed 6-3 when the neighbours met in the league in October at Etihad Stadium, but United gained a measure of revenge with a 2-1 victory at Old Trafford three months later. programme.desc: After a series of violent murders scandalises Victorian London, the media-dubbed Limehouse Golem strikes fear into the hearts of the public. Into this melting pot is thrust well-intentioned inspector John Kildare, who has never been given a murder case before. The Scotland Yard sleuth knows he has been set up to fail, but soon uncovers a lead that implicates Karl Marx, George Gissing and the popular music hall star Dan Leno. He follows the trail, wherever it may lead, through the seediest and most intriguing parts of London. Thriller, starring Bill Nighy, Douglas Booth and Olivia Cooke

This is their very last chance to pull out all the stops, show everything they've learned along the way and demonstrate the kind of cook they have become. programme.title: Who Do You Think You Are?
programme.desc:
Andrew Lloyd Webber: Composer Andrew Lloyd Webber knows he comes from a musical family, including virtuoso cellist brother Julian, but he is curious as to where his showbusiness genes and love of musical theatre come from. By following his mother's line, Andrew soon uncovers a certain Uncle Peregrine, who played a key role under Wellington at the Battle of Waterloo. On his father's side, Henry Simmonds was a missionary who dedicated his life to helping the poor and needy. Andrew is astonished to uncover stories that uncannily parallel his own life, including an ancestor with a famous cello-playing brother

Premier League-winners City claimed a 3-0 win over Championship side Sheffield United in the semi-finals, before United overcame Brighton & Hove Albion on penalties to reach their second Wembley final of the campaign, having already lifted the Carabao Cup. programme.desc:

This is their very last chance to pull out all the stops, show everything they've learned along the way and demonstrate the kind of cook they have become. programme.title: Who Do You Think You Are?
programme.desc:
Andrew Lloyd Webber: Composer Andrew Lloyd Webber knows he comes from a musical family, including virtuoso cellist brother Julian, but he is curious as to where his showbusiness genes and love of musical theatre come from. By following his mother's line, Andrew soon uncovers a certain Uncle Peregrine, who played a key role under Wellington at the Battle of Waterloo. On his father's side, Henry Simmonds was a missionary who dedicated his life to helping the poor and needy. Andrew is astonished to uncover stories that uncannily parallel his own life, including an ancestor with a famous cello-playing brother
S20E01

programme.title: Match of the Day Live: The FA Cup
programme.desc: Manchester City v Manchester United (Kick-off 3.00pm). Gary Lineker presents coverage of the final from Wembley Stadium, as the local rivals battle it out for the prestigious trophy. Premier League-winners City claimed a 3-0 win over Championship side Sheffield United in the semi-finals, before United overcame Brighton & Hove Albion on penalties to reach their second Wembley final of the campaign, having already lifted the Carabao Cup. The Citizens prevailed 6-3 when the neighbours met in the league in October at Etihad Stadium, but United gained a measure of revenge with a 2-1 victory at Old Trafford three months later. With analysis from Alan Shearer, Micah Richards and Peter Schmeichel

programme.title: The Limehouse Golem (2016)
programme.desc: After a series of violent murders scandalises Victorian London, the media-dubbed Limehouse Golem strikes fear into the hearts of the public. Into this melting pot is thrust well-intentioned inspector John Kildare, who has never been given a murder case before. The Scotland Yard sleuth knows he has been set up to fail, but soon uncovers a lead that implicates Karl Marx, George Gissing and the popular music hall star Dan Leno. He follows the trail, wherever it may lead, through the seediest and most intriguing parts of London. Thriller, starring Bill Nighy, Douglas Booth and Olivia Cooke

Briosgaidean/Biscuits: Biscuit-loving Fox realises he is in bad shape. His friends want to help him to get fit, but he fails at all the exercises they suggest
S01E01

programme.title: Shane an Chef
programme.desc:
Magaidh's new prize pig has gone missing, and Shane is challenges to make a salad that Mario will eat
S01E02

programme.title: Oscar & Ealasaid
programme.desc:
An Trèana gu Deas/Southern Express: A new train that goes directly to the ocean has just opened in town. Célestine would love to go there with Ernest, but the ticket is very expensive
S01E14

programme.title: Su Pic (Peek Zoo)
programme.desc:
Latha Craibt’ nan Càmhal: When the camels wake up in a bad mood, Doctor Sue needs to be sent for to get provide assistance
S01E26

programme.title: Stòiridh
programme.desc:
Air Cnoc Grad: Iain MacInnes reads Air Cnoc Grad by Linda Sarah, illustrated by Benji Davies and translated into Gaelic by Jo Macdonald
S02E24

programme.title: An Saoghal Droil aig Pol Ploc/The Rubbish World of Dave Spud
programme.desc:
Cho Còir ri Muc-mhara/A Whaley Good Time: Fuzzypeg the dog eats the Spuds’ fish supper and Dave is tasked with catching another
S01E03

programme.title: Caractaran
programme.desc:
Ellen Macdonald introduces some of the characters who have visited the CBBC ALBA studio recently, including Violet Beauregarde and the BFG
S01E01

programme.title: A-null 's a-nall
programme.desc:
Titch: When Titch meets a genie and is granted a wish, he is sure that there is only one thing that will make his life better - to be taller. However, the little lad is about to face some bigger problems. Short Gaelic film for younger viewers
S01E05

programme.title: Stri
programme.desc:
The CBBC ALBA presenters love a good challenge but who will emerge victorious as Ehrinn joins them?
S01E03

programme.title: Triuir aig Tri
programme.desc:
Della is worried about how to pay the mounting bills at Number 3
S01E03

programme.title: Vets: Gach Creutair Beo
programme.desc:
A young pug undergoes surgery at Glasgow Vet School and Ealasaid Dick is out and about in Benbecula and Uist tending to sheep and cattle
S06E08

programme.title: SpeakGaelic
programme.desc:
Gnothachas | Business: Joy Dunlop guides viewers through the first steps of speaking Gaelic
S03E07

programme.title: An Là (News)
programme.desc: Local, national and international news and information from BBC ALBA

programme.title: Miann na Maighdinn-mara/Mermaid Tales
programme.desc:
Kate Macleod comes across an interesting sea creature, known as a sunfish, which is native to tropical waters, but is likely to have been carried to the islands by the Gulf Stream
S02E02

programme.title: Farpaisean Chon-Chaorach (Sheepdog Trials)
programme.desc:
Day two of the International Sheep Dog Trial in Brechin, presented by Donald MacSween and Catriona MacPhee
S12E02

programme.title: Na Millenni-Gaels
programme.desc:
Anton and Alisha are now parents to a little baby girl. They take her to meet the children in the nursery, who are amazed at how small she is and form some interesting ideas
S01E03

programme.title: Ameireaga agus an t-Olocost
programme.desc:
Documentary examining how the American people and leaders responded to the Holocaust, one of the greatest humanitarian disasters of the 20th century
S01E04

programme.title: Binneas
programme.desc:
Binneas - Na Trads: Highlights from the Trad Awards 2022, including music by Tom Orr
S2022E02

programme.title: Mach à Seo!
programme.desc:
An Roinn Eorpa: A fun-packed trip to Ljubljana in Slovenia with Ramsay MacMahon, including a visit to the mountains and lakes of the Julian Alps. Ramsay also explores the subterranean world of the Karst region and joins the revellers at one of the biggest festivals in Europe
S07E01

programme.title: Thuige Seo
programme.desc:
Brigadier John MacFarlane: The first of two programmes shown in tribute to the late Brigadier John MacFarlane. Donald Morrison talks to the Second World War veteran, formerly of the Army School of Languages, and an authority on Gaelic history
S01E02

programme.title: Monte Cassino
programme.desc: Brigadier John MacFarlane visits the Franciscan monastery bombed by the Allies during the Second World War, exploring the history and impact the series of battles had on the Italian hill-top abbey. He also visits the final resting place of those killed during the campaign, and talks to veterans of the battle

programme.title: The Cutter
programme.desc: The story behind one of Runrig's best known tracks

programme.title: Prosbaig
programme.desc:
Housing issues on Eigg, the founding of a Scottish Motor Neurone Society by a man from Lewis diagnosed with the disease, and studies on radiation levels in island populations feature in Donald Morrison's latest collection of reports from the 1980s
S01E06

programme.title: Leugh Mi (Book Show)
programme.desc:
Anna Macleod is joined by guests Josie Burgess and Ricky Hannaway, who discuss books of special interest to them. Josie chats about a collection of short stories, A' Ghlainne agus sgeulachdan eile, by Màiri E NicLeòid, and reads a comical excerpt from An Detox. Ricky has selected the Second World War classic set in Japan, Empire of the Sun by JG Ballard
S05E01

programme.title: Eilean Mo Ghaoil (From Lewis with Love)

programme.desc: Performers take part in the 2018 Edinburgh Military Tattoo, including Switzerland's Top Secret Drum Corps, the Central Band of the Czech Armed Forces and the RAF

programme.title: Springwatch: Spring’s Natural Revelations
programme.desc: Spring is a season of new life and hopefulness, when anything seems possible in the longer days ahead. It can be the most dramatic, expectant and optimistic of seasons when our trees and hedgerows display leaves of every shade of green, wildflowers burst into life in our hay meadows, and blossom festoons our orchards. Our wildlife has a spring in its step too as lives are consumed with mating, hatching and survival. Springwatch has been filming the very best wildlife with unique stories to tell

Our wildlife has a spring in its step too as lives are consumed with mating, hatching and survival. Springwatch has been filming the very best wildlife with unique stories to tell

It can be the most dramatic, expectant and optimistic of seasons when our trees and hedgerows display leaves of every shade of green, wildflowers burst into life in our hay meadows, and blossom festoons our orchards. Our wildlife has a spring in its step too as lives are consumed with mating, hatching and survival. Springwatch has been filming the very best wildlife with unique stories to tell

It can be the most dramatic, expectant and optimistic of seasons when our trees and hedgerows display leaves of every shade of green, wildflowers burst into life in our hay meadows, and blossom festoons our orchards. Our wildlife has a spring in its step too as lives are consumed with mating, hatching and survival. Springwatch has been filming the very best wildlife with unique stories to tell

Our wildlife has a spring in its step too as lives are consumed with mating, hatching and survival. Springwatch has been filming the very best wildlife with unique stories to tell

Our wildlife has a spring in its step too as lives are consumed with mating, hatching and survival. Springwatch has been filming the very best wildlife with unique stories to tell

It can be the most dramatic, expectant and optimistic of seasons when our trees and hedgerows display leaves of every shade of green, wildflowers burst into life in our hay meadows, and blossom festoons our orchards. Our wildlife has a spring in its step too as lives are consumed with mating, hatching and survival. Springwatch has been filming the very best wildlife with unique stories to tell

programme.title: Amol Rajan Interviews
programme.desc: An interview with Bob Woodward and Carl Bernstein, the journalists at the heart of the Watergate scandal, about the fall of Nixon, the presidency of Trump and the state of America and the world today. Amol Rajan questions the pair on some of the most important issues of modern times and explores the parallels between recent events and the scandal that eventually led to the resignation of the 37th US president

programme.title: BBC News
programme.desc: The latest national and international stories as they break

programme.title: Talking Business
programme.desc: In this week's Talking Business, Aaron Heslehurst travels to Rabat to explore Morocco's push into big renewable energy projects. Morocco wants to be a net exporter of clean energy to its neighbours and Europe but it still sources 40% of its own electricity from imported coal. How realistic is Morocco's move towards net zero and how quickly can it achieve it.

programme.title: Unspun World with John Simpson
programme.desc: Unspun World provides an unvarnished version of the week's major global news stories - reliable, honest and essential viewing. The BBC's world affairs editor John Simpson brings his experience and expertise to bear on the most important international stories. In discussion with the BBC's unparalleled range of experts across the world he uses their unique local knowledge to go beyond the headlines to get to the unspun truth about the world.

programme.title: BBC News
programme.desc: The latest national and international stories as they break

programme.title: Our World
programme.desc: Once dubbed the 'murder capital' of the world, for nearly three decades, rival gangs ruled the streets of El Salvador through a regime of violence, extortion and fear. That is, until now. For the last year, the country's young, media-savvy president has launched a full-scale war on gangs, imposing emergency constitutional measures and giving police sweeping new powers of arrest. As the State of Exception passes its one-year anniversary, more than 65,000 people have been arrested and dramatic images of a new 'mega prison' hit headlines around the world. But as the country transforms before people's eyes, this newfound freedom hides a dark reality. The government is accused of locking up thousands of innocent people without trial and in flagrant abuse of their human rights. Will Grant meets families impacted by both sides of this controversial policy to uncover the hidden cost of peace on the streets.

programme.title: BBC News
programme.desc: The latest national and international stories as they break

programme.title: Talking Business
programme.desc: In this week's Talking Business, Aaron Heslehurst travels to Rabat to explore Morocco's push into big renewable energy projects. programme.desc: An interview with Bob Woodward and Carl Bernstein, the journalists at the heart of the Watergate scandal, about the fall of Nixon, the presidency of Trump and the state of America and the world today. programme.title: Our World
programme.desc: Once dubbed the 'murder capital' of the world, for nearly three decades, rival gangs ruled the streets of El Salvador through a regime of violence, extortion and fear. That is, until now. For the last year, the country's young, media-savvy president has launched a full-scale war on gangs, imposing emergency constitutional measures and giving police sweeping new powers of arrest. As the State of Exception passes its one-year anniversary, more than 65,000 people have been arrested and dramatic images of a new 'mega prison' hit headlines around the world. But as the country transforms before people's eyes, this newfound freedom hides a dark reality. The government is accused of locking up thousands of innocent people without trial and in flagrant abuse of their human rights. Will Grant meets families impacted by both sides of this controversial policy to uncover the hidden cost of peace on the streets.

programme.title: Himalaya with Michael Palin
programme.desc:
Bhutan to the Bay of Bengal: Michael's journey takes him to Bhutan, where he enjoys a last glimpse of the Himalaya before heading to Paro to enjoy a Buddhist festival. Here he witnesses archery contests and the unfolding of a giant scroll during the night of a full moon
S01E06

programme.title: Artsnight
programme.desc:
Michael Palin Meets Jan Morris: Python and broadcaster Michael Palin travels to north Wales to interview travel writer Jan Morris. Originally born as James, she shot to fame as part of the team that conquered Mount Everest in 1953. She spent the next two decades travelling the world, interviewing figures such as Che Guevara, producing reports for Panorama and writing books about other countries. Her 1972 gender reassignment was chronicled in her book Conundrum, and here she tells Michael the secret to her long and happy life
S04E02

programme.title: Timeshift
programme.desc:
Battle for the Himalayas: The Fight to Film Everest: Documentary charting the story of how film-makers used the Himalayan mountains for propaganda, as the world's great powers sent military-style expeditions to conquer the peaks between the 1920s and the 1960s. As a result, some of the range's most iconic mountaineering feats have been captured on film, including the preparations for Mallory and Irvine ill-fated ascent of Mount Everest in 1924, and the final conquest of the mountain by Hillary and Tenzing in 1953
S14E04

programme.title: Afterglow
programme.desc:
Patient Pathway: Arild secretly struggles, Jorund develops health anxiety and Finn decides the time has come to turn his life around. Ester learns what chemotherapy involves. In Norwegian
S01E03

programme.title: Afterglow
programme.desc:
The Wedding: Ester begins chemotherapy, as two of her closest friends tie the knot and her teenage son Lars falls in love. Jorund is still convinced there must be something wrong with him and orders a full medical examination. In Norwegian
S01E04

programme.title: A Little Chaos (2014)
programme.desc: A female landscape designer in 17th-century France challenges boundaries of class and gender when she is chosen by King Louis XIV to create a new garden for the palace of Versailles. She becomes romantically involved with a fellow designer, whose creative philosophy is the opposite of hers. Period drama, starring Kate Winslet, Matthias Schoenaerts, Stanley Tucci and Alan Rickman, who also directed

programme.title: As Time Goes By
programme.desc:
The Cruise: Lionel asks Jean to accompany him on an all-expenses-paid cruise, but she remains unmoved by his efforts to woo her. Comedy, starring Judi Dench and Geoffrey Palmer
S02E06

programme.title: Whatever Happened to the Likely Lads?
programme.desc:
I'll Never Forget Whatshername: Terry decides he would like to track down some of his former girlfriends - little suspecting the shocks that await him. James Bolam stars
S01E05

programme.title: H2O: The Molecule That Made Us
programme.desc:
Crisis: Storm chasers and photographers track the global changes in storms and floods across America, while Nasa's Grace satellites reveal global overuse of aquifers
S01E03

programme.title: Artsnight
programme.desc:
Michael Palin Meets Jan Morris: Python and broadcaster Michael Palin travels to north Wales to interview travel writer Jan Morris. Originally born as James, she shot to fame as part of the team that conquered Mount Everest in 1953. She spent the next two decades travelling the world, interviewing figures such as Che Guevara, producing reports for Panorama and writing books about other countries. Her 1972 gender reassignment was chronicled in her book Conundrum, and here she tells Michael the secret to her long and happy life
S04E02

programme.title: Queen Victoria: My Musical Britain
programme.desc: Lucy Worsley explores the character and legacy of the famous monarch through music, considering how Victoria used music to bring the country together during a time of great upheaval and change. Lucy also examines the role music played in the monarch's own life - as a queen, a private person and in her marriage - and how Victoria and Albert established institutions like the Royal College of Music and the Royal Albert Hall. The documentary features performances by Willard White, the BBC Symphony Orchestra and Black Dyke Brass Band

programme.title: Gilbert and Sullivan's Yeomen of the Guard
programme.desc: English National Opera's new production of the much-loved Gilbert & Sullivan classic, a fast-paced caper set in the Tower of London, with the action shifted to the 1950s, the time of the Queen's coronation. Colonel Fairfax is under sentence of death. Can his old friend, the Beefeater Sergeant Merryl, save him? And what of Merryl's daughter Phoebe, who has fallen hopelessly in love with the colonel? Anthony Gregory and Neal Davies lead the cast, with the Orchestra & Chorus of ENO conducted by Chris Hopkins

programme.title: Cilla in Scandinavia
programme.desc: Cilla Black hosts a 1971 show specially recorded in Stockholm on Midsummer's Day and on film locations in Norway, Sweden and Finland. Guests include Ringo Starr, Sven-Bertil Taube, Basil Brush, Hannu Mikkola and Marvin, Welch & Farrar

programme.title: Cilla
programme.desc: Archive performances by Cilla Black, who sings Step Inside Love, For Once in My Life and Liverpool Lullaby. She also duets with Georrgie Fame and Dusty Springfield, and there's a comedy sketch from Graeme Garden, Tim Brooke-Taylor and Graham Chapman

programme.title: Queen Victoria: My Musical Britain
programme.desc: Lucy Worsley explores the character and legacy of the famous monarch through music, considering how Victoria used music to bring the country together during a time of great upheaval and change. Lucy also examines the role music played in the monarch's own life - as a queen, a private person and in her marriage - and how Victoria and Albert established institutions like the Royal College of Music and the Royal Albert Hall. The documentary features performances by Willard White, the BBC Symphony Orchestra and Black Dyke Brass Band

programme.title: Britain and the Sea
programme.desc:
Trade & Romance: David Dimbleby investigates the importance of the sea to trade and to the individual livelihoods of coastal communities. He sails along the west coast of Scotland, starting at Craobh Haven and along the Crinan Canal, a waterway designed by East Lothian engineer John Rennie to take 120 miles off the journey from the west coast to Glasgow and safely avoid the turbulent waters around the Mull of Kintyre. He also climbs aboard the last working sea-going Clyde puffer, where he earns his keep shovelling coal in the steam room, and reflects on the role played by the river in both trade and shipbuilding
S01E03

programme.title: The Pennine Way
programme.desc:
Adventurer Paul Rose pulls on his hiking boots to explore the 268-mile Pennine Way. His first leg takes him from Edale to Calderdale, and along the way he tells the story of Tom Stephenson, who fought landowners and governments to win public access to the full route. He also meets author and director Barrie Rutter, who recalls some of the literary greats who have lived nearby, including Ted Hughes and the Brontes
S01E01

programme.title: Fred Dibnah's Building of Britain
programme.desc:
The Art of Castle Building: The ex-steeplejack tours the coast of north Wales, visiting Harlech, Caernarfon and Beaumaris to admire the defensive features of the strongholds that helped Edward I subdue the Welsh. On the orders of the king, French architect Master James of St Georges revolutionised castle design in England
S01E02

programme.title: Italy's Invisible Cities
programme.desc:
Florence: Using 3D technology, Alexander Armstrong and Dr Michael Scott explore Florence, and with the help of historian Ross King and the team, they discover the hidden secrets of the city's great cathedral and its architectural genius. The pair also learn more about the Medici's fraught relationship with Michelangelo, as he fell from favour when he supported a rebellion against his own masters, and visit the world-famous Uffizi - including the Botticelli room
S01E03

programme.title: Britain's Lost Masterpieces
programme.desc:
Glasgow: Social historian Emma Dabiri and Dr Bendor Grosvenor travel to Glasgow to investigate a long-lost picture of George Villiers, Duke of Buckingham, who was the lover of James VI of Scotland, possibly painted by one of the most famous artists in history
S02E01

programme.title: Britain's Biggest Warship
programme.desc:
Crewing Up: Film-maker Chris Terrill captures an intimate and personal portrait of life on board ultra-modern super aircraft carrier HMS Queen Elizabeth, as its crew learns the intricacies of a warship that will change the way Britain goes to war. In this first instalment, early 2016 sees sailors begin to arrive in Rosyth dockyard in Scotland where the ship is still in construction, but nearing completion. Captain Jerry Kyd and his 700 sailors are assembling to take the prototype warship to sea for the first time. These trials herald what should be 50 years of service
S01E01

programme.title: Imagine
programme.desc: Kate Prince: Imagine: Kate Prince is a remarkable British dance pioneer whose renowned ZooNation company has transformed the profile of hip-hop and street dance across the country. Alan Yentob meets the choreographer as she prepares for her project Message in a Bottle, a West End production set to the songs of Sting. The programme follows the highs and lows of birthing a complex new dance show from day one in the studio to opening night, while also exploring the wider impact of Prince's work and politics on a younger generation of upcoming dancers

programme.title: The Pennine Way
programme.desc:
Adventurer Paul Rose pulls on his hiking boots to explore the 268-mile Pennine Way. His first leg takes him from Edale to Calderdale, and along the way he tells the story of Tom Stephenson, who fought landowners and governments to win public access to the full route. He also meets author and director Barrie Rutter, who recalls some of the literary greats who have lived nearby, including Ted Hughes and the Brontes
S01E01

programme.title: Fred Dibnah's Building of Britain
programme.desc:
The Art of Castle Building: The ex-steeplejack tours the coast of north Wales, visiting Harlech, Caernarfon and Beaumaris to admire the defensive features of the strongholds that helped Edward I subdue the Welsh. On the orders of the king, French architect Master James of St Georges revolutionised castle design in England
S01E02

programme.title: Italy's Invisible Cities
programme.desc:
Florence: Using 3D technology, Alexander Armstrong and Dr Michael Scott explore Florence, and with the help of historian Ross King and the team, they discover the hidden secrets of the city's great cathedral and its architectural genius. The pair also learn more about the Medici's fraught relationship with Michelangelo, as he fell from favour when he supported a rebellion against his own masters, and visit the world-famous Uffizi - including the Botticelli room
S01E03

programme.title: Britain's Lost Masterpieces
programme.desc:
Glasgow: Social historian Emma Dabiri and Dr Bendor Grosvenor travel to Glasgow to investigate a long-lost picture of George Villiers, Duke of Buckingham, who was the lover of James VI of Scotland, possibly painted by one of the most famous artists in history
S02E01

programme.title: The Pennine Way
programme.desc:
Paul Rose's continuing journey takes him into the Yorkshire Dales, where 50 years ago the Pennine Way was launched in the village of Malham. Paul hears from those who remember the opening ceremony, before pulling on his climbing gear to attempt the limestone cliff face of Malham Cove. He also visits a sheep sale in Wensleydale and enjoys a pint in Britain's highest pub
S01E02

programme.title: Fred Dibnah's Building of Britain
programme.desc:
The Age of the Carpenter: Turning his attentions to timber structures from the Middle Ages the former steeplejack visits England's oldest fortified building with a moat, Stokesay Castle. He also journeys to Harvington Hall near Kidderminster, Worcestershire, to see how bricks became an important part of timber-framed houses
S01E03

programme.title: As Time Goes By
programme.desc:
The Book Signing: Jean is concerned for Lionel's success as the day of his book launch arrives and wonders if Alistair will be able to help out with a publicity stunt should sales start to flag. Romantic comedy, starring Judi Dench and Geoffrey Palmer
S02E07

programme.title: Whatever Happened to the Likely Lads?
programme.desc:
Birthday Boy: Bob and Thelma throw a surprise party to cheer up Terry - but the blindfolded guest of honour begins to insult old friends, unaware they are listening to his every word
S01E06

programme.title: Close to Vermeer
programme.desc: Behind the scenes of the largest Vermeer exhibition ever mounted, now on view at the Rijksmuseum in Amsterdam. The documentary follows curators, conservators, collectors and experts in their joint mission to shine a new light on the elusive Dutch Master

programme.title: Expedition Volcano
programme.desc:
Part two of two. The team takes a helicopter to the crater of an active volcano in the Democratic Republic of Congo that has rarely been studied. The mountain is surrounded by forests, which provide cover for armed militant groups, and the scientists will only have a few short hours to gather information. They then move on to the surrounding area, a dangerous landscape marked by craters from past eruptions
S01E02

programme.title: Britain and the Sea
programme.desc:
Pleasure & Escape: David Dimbleby sails along the coast of East Anglia, exploring how Britain's view of the sea has changed over the past 200 years. The coast and the beach became a playground for the nation, inspiring artists, transforming coastal architecture and creating a seaside culture that remains uniquely British. Setting out from Gorleston-on-Sea, he travels down the Suffolk and Essex coasts and into the Thames, until he reaches Greenwich. Along the way he discovers works of art that reflect Britain's evolving relationship with the sea, meets a sand sculptor and visits the Queen's House in Greenwich, built in 1616 as a waterside retreat for Queen Anne and now home to Britain's greatest collection of maritime artefacts
S01E04

programme.title: Storyville
programme.desc: Documentary using archive performance footage and interviews to explore the life of Miriam Makeba, the Johannesburg-born singer and civil rights activist who was forced into exile in 1960 for opposing the apartheid regime. Miriam became one of the first South African musicians to make a name for herself on the international scene, and she used her music to deliver messages against racism and poverty

programme.title: The Pennine Way
programme.desc:
Paul Rose's continuing journey takes him into the Yorkshire Dales, where 50 years ago the Pennine Way was launched in the village of Malham. Paul hears from those who remember the opening ceremony, before pulling on his climbing gear to attempt the limestone cliff face of Malham Cove. He also visits a sheep sale in Wensleydale and enjoys a pint in Britain's highest pub
S01E02

programme.title: Fred Dibnah's Building of Britain
programme.desc:
The Age of the Carpenter: Turning his attentions to timber structures from the Middle Ages the former steeplejack visits England's oldest fortified building with a moat, Stokesay Castle. He also journeys to Harvington Hall near Kidderminster, Worcestershire, to see how bricks became an important part of timber-framed houses
S01E03

programme.title: Britain and the Sea
programme.desc:
Pleasure & Escape: David Dimbleby sails along the coast of East Anglia, exploring how Britain's view of the sea has changed over the past 200 years. The coast and the beach became a playground for the nation, inspiring artists, transforming coastal architecture and creating a seaside culture that remains uniquely British. Setting out from Gorleston-on-Sea, he travels down the Suffolk and Essex coasts and into the Thames, until he reaches Greenwich. Along the way he discovers works of art that reflect Britain's evolving relationship with the sea, meets a sand sculptor and visits the Queen's House in Greenwich, built in 1616 as a waterside retreat for Queen Anne and now home to Britain's greatest collection of maritime artefacts
S01E04

programme.title: The Pennine Way
programme.desc:
Polar adventurer Paul Rose heads for the North Pennines in the latest stage of his journey. He goes white-water rafting down the River Tees - and takes in one of Britain's best views at High Cup Nick. He also hears about a weather phenomenon unique to the Pennine Way and spends a night at a remote mountain refuge close to the highest point of the route
S01E03

programme.title: Fred Dibnah's Building of Britain
programme.desc:
Scottish Style: Fred Dibnah demonstrates the engineering and design skills that shaped Scottish baronial style. He visits Glamis Castle to show how the sandstone tower was transformed by Italian plasterers to resemble a fairy-tale castle, and the House of Dun near Montrose, designed by William Adam
S01E04

programme.title: Thailand: Earth's Tropical Paradise
programme.desc:
The Secrets of the South: Exploring the wildlife and culture of the Southeast Asian nation. The first episode examines the south of the country, a popular tourist destination for Westerners, and examines the role of spirituality in daily life. Narrated by Sophie Okonedo
S01E01

programme.title: Secrets of Size: Atoms to Supergalaxies
programme.desc:
Going Big: Part two of two. Jim Al-Khalili explores the largest known cosmic structures, including, a vast cloud of solar plasma which surrounds and protects the solar system, the black hole at the centre of the Milky Way, which emits the lowest note ever heard in the cosmos, and the giant arc, a collection of galaxies which spans more than three per cent of the observable universe
S01E02

programme.title: The Long Roads
programme.desc: An elderly Scottish woman learns she is dying of cancer, so she and her cantankerous old husband set off to visit their children - now geographically and socially miles apart - and inform them of the news. One-off drama by John McGrath, and starring Edith MacArthur and Robert Urquhart. Originally broadcast in 1993

programme.title: Tails You Win: The Science of Chance
programme.desc: Professor David Spiegelhalter tries to get to grips with chance and how it works. He tackles such questions as whether people are wise to take an umbrella when they go out, to ways of maximising the chances of living to 100, as he tries to establish if luck and fate are embedded in the fabric of the universe. Along the way, he discovers hidden patterns and shapes in a book written exclusively with numbers and explains why going sky-diving only marginally increases his risk of dying sooner rather than later

programme.title: The Pennine Way
programme.desc:
Polar adventurer Paul Rose heads for the North Pennines in the latest stage of his journey. He goes white-water rafting down the River Tees - and takes in one of Britain's best views at High Cup Nick. He also hears about a weather phenomenon unique to the Pennine Way and spends a night at a remote mountain refuge close to the highest point of the route

S01E02

programme.title: The Pennine Way
programme.desc:
Polar adventurer Paul Rose explores rural Northumberland as he embarks on the last stage of his journey along the Pennine Way. He makes a remarkable discovery at the Roman archaeological dig at Vindolanda, finds out what lies beyond the red flags while on exercise with the Grenadier Guards and discovers how night-time walkers can have an almost magical experience in an area acclaimed for the quality of its dark skies
S01E04

programme.title: Fred Dibnah's Building of Britain
programme.desc:
Building the Canals: Fred explores the work of the builders responsible for the waterways of Britain. Visiting the Leeds-Liverpool and Bridgewater canals, he explores their industrial history and demonstrates how early pioneers dug the canals and made them watertight, creating some of Britain's finest engineering
S01E05

programme.title: A House Through Time
programme.desc:
David Olusoga explores the house's history from the 1880s to the First World War, a period that saw the property sliding down the social scale and turning from a family home to a multiple occupancy. He discovers how a resident responded to the death of his baby daughter by opening a milk bar for the temperance movement, only to get into legal trouble for watering down his product. David also discovers the story behind a mysterious occupant who lived in the house under a pseudonym and learns how the battle of Passchendaele changed the residents' lives forever
S03E03

programme.title: Casablanca (1942)
programme.desc: The American expat owner of a Moroccan nightclub is reunited with his old flame during the Second World War. Now married to a Czech freedom fighter, she needs his help to get them safely out of the country before they are captured by the Nazis - but the former lovers also have to wrestle the temptation to rekindle their simmering romance. Drama, with Humphrey Bogart, Ingrid Bergman, Claude Rains and Paul Henreid

programme.title: Imagine
programme.desc: Ingrid Bergman in Her Own Words - Imagine: Director Stig Bjorkman's film profiles Oscar-winning Swedish actress Ingrid Bergman, who became one of the most celebrated stars of American and world cinema. With contributions from her daughters Isabella Rossellini and Pia Lindstrom, with Alicia Vikander reading from the Hollywood icon's letters and diaries

programme.title: Top of the Pops
programme.desc: Simon Mayo introduces music from late October 1994, featuring Snap, China Black, Pink Floyd, Rozalla, Sting, Bon Jovi, Green Day, East 17 and Pato Banton

programme.title: Top of the Pops

programme.title: In Concert: Gordon Lightfoot
programme.desc: A concert by the Canadian singer-songwriter, accompanied by Red Shea and Richard Haynes. The trio perform songs including Summer Side of Life, Saturday Clothes, That's What You Get for Loving Me, If I Could Read Your Mind and Steel Rail Blues

programme.title: Sounds of the Sixties
programme.desc:

programme.title: Once Were Brothers: Robbie Robertson and the Band (2019)
programme.desc: The story of how the Canadian guitarist overcame adversity and found camaraderie alongside the four other men who would become his brothers in music in the Band. The film blends rare archive footage, photography, songs and interviews with Robertson's friends and collaborators, including Martin Scorsese, Bruce Springsteen, Eric Clapton and Van Morrison

programme.title: Later... with Jools Holland
programme.desc: Jools introduces a diverse mix of musical performances from the American folk, blues, bluegrass and country scenes. Featuring Robert Plant and Alison Krauss, Carolina Chocolate Drops, Odetta, Emmylou Harris, Norah Jones, Buddy Guy and Johnny Cash

programme.title: Monty Don's Japanese Gardens
programme.desc:
The first of two programmes in which Monty travels to Japan in spring to explore different aspects of the nation's gardens. Amidst the cherry blossoms, he begins his journey by visiting the earliest surviving boating garden of the Heian period. He also looks at the rolling green moss of a Buddhist garden and learns the secrets of creating a Zen landscape before visiting an unconventional garden created by a modern design legend. The presenter also learns about the art of Japanese stonemasonry, the famous tea ceremonies and receives a lesson in the delicate art of traditional flower arranging
S01E01

programme.title: Voyages of Discovery
programme.desc:
Circumnavigation: Paul Rose discovers the truth behind the first circumnavigation of the world. More than 500 years ago, Ferdinand Magellan set out to find the riches of the Spice Islands, but contrary to popular perception, he failed to reach them. A dramatic sequence of events followed, involving mutiny and murder, as his scurvy-ridden crew continued the journey without him
S01E01

programme.title: Afterglow
programme.desc:
Mystery Break: Chemotherapy takes its toll on Ester. Jorund tries to make up with Charlotte but suspects she may be hiding bigger secrets. Lars invites love interest Miko on a date. In Norwegian
S01E05

programme.title: Afterglow
programme.desc:
Zero Point: Ester wonders whether she has the strength to continue with the harshness of her treatment. Arild is invited to Japan on a once-in-a-life time work trip. Jorund gets a nasty shock. In Norwegian
S01E06

programme.title: Afterglow
programme.desc:
The Hour of Truth: Ester gets to find out if the treatment she endured has worked. Jorund must decide if he intends to forgive Charlotte, and Finn reveals a big secret he has been carrying around for many years. In Norwegian
S01E07

programme.title: Timewatch
programme.desc:
The Real Bonnie and Clyde: Timewatch: Documentary about American outlaws Bonnie Parker and Clyde Barrow. With unprecedented access to gang members' memoirs, family archives and recently released police records, Timewatch searches for the true story of the couple and their mob. While Hollywood portrayed the pair as the most glamorous outlaws in American history, the reality of life on the run was one of violence, hardship and danger. Narrated by Michael Praed
S30E03

programme.title: As Time Goes By
programme.desc:
The Book Signing: Jean is concerned for Lionel's success as the day of his book launch arrives and wonders if Alistair will be able to help out with a publicity stunt should sales start to flag. Romantic comedy, starring Judi Dench and Geoffrey Palmer
S02E07

programme.title: Whatever Happened to the Likely Lads?
programme.desc:
Birthday Boy: Bob and Thelma throw a surprise party to cheer up Terry - but the blindfolded guest of honour begins to insult old friends, unaware they are listening to his every word
S01E06
