programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Liverpool 1/5: This competition takes place in and around Liverpool, where the first to host is 41-year-old taxi business owner Rob, who plans a Scouse themed evening. The guests he is hoping to impress are 23-year-old fitness fanatic Toria, 44-year-old property developer Christine, 40-year-old South African business woman Sam, and 20-year-old student Inzy

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Liverpool 2/5: It is night two in Liverpool, and the turn of businesswoman Sam to try and impress with her South-African-themed evening, though her food is a bit hit and miss

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Liverpool 3/5: Gym worker Toria hosts the third party in Liverpool, and hopes a kissing game around the dinner table, along with her flaky flapjacks, will be enough to secure the £1,000 prize

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Liverpool 4/5: Undergraduate Inzy is the fourth host in Liverpool, and he is on a mission to prove students really can cook. The flirting between him and Toria continues, but will he allow love to stand in way of the competition?

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Liverpool 5/5: In Liverpool, property developer Christine plans to wow her guests with a Spanish holiday-themed dinner party. However, the mood is rather more feisty than fiesta as on-going tensions finally come to a head and it's not long before the honesty - and the sparks - begin to fly

programme.title: Sun, Sea and Selling Houses
programme.desc:
Retired bricklayer Paul plans to lay down new roots in Alicante, hoping to find a place where he can barbecue under sunny skies - although wife Jean's only request is a dishwasher
S05E03

programme.title: Sun, Sea and Selling Houses
programme.desc:
Mother-and-son estate agents Sharon and Shaun Garner help Portsmouth pair Colin and Tracy find their perfect property in Almería. With 16 years' experience, it should be plain sailing for the Garners - until they discover that Tracy was also an estate agent. So with everything to prove the pressure is on to deliver the dream. Meanwhile, in Málaga, Surrey-based fitness fan Faiz searches for a holiday home in Duquesa
S05E04

programme.title: Sun, Sea and Selling Houses
programme.desc:
Estate agents the Garners and the Rodriguezes revisit some of their ex-clients to see how their property purchases and lives have been transformed since making the big move from the UK. In Almería, mother-and-son duo Sharon and Shaun Garner catch up with naturists Brian and Hilary who wanted to escape the chilly British weather for a climate that was more compatible with their hobby, while sisters Sophie and Charlotte Rodriguez re-visit Ian and Helen who were looking for a holiday home that came with rental potential
S05E05

programme.title: Sun, Sea and Selling Houses
programme.desc:
In Málaga, Shani and Andrew Hamilton are poised to help Chris and Julie realise their 30-year dream of living in Spain. The couple have 230,000 euros to spend on a property with plenty of outside space, as they wish to prioritise al fresco living. In Alicante, Charlotte Rodriguez and her brother-in-law Damon team up for the first time to help retired Derbyshire police force pairing Lynne and Mark find a holiday home that they can eventually move to permanently
S05E07

programme.title: A Place in the Sun
programme.desc: 2019: Dordogne: Lecturer Maxine and paramedic team leader Cormac got married in the scenic northern region of the Dordogne in France, and now want Ben Hillman's help to find them their dream holiday home there. They have a budget of just over £100,000 and would ideally like a property with lots of outside space, just a short walk from the town of Riberac

programme.title: A Place in the Sun
programme.desc: 2012: Orlando, Florida: Jonnie Irwin takes house-hunters Alan and Michele Raine from Sunderland to Orlando to find a family holiday home. With property prices in Florida costing half what they were five years earlier, can Jonnie help them to pick a bargain in the sun?

programme.title: A Place in the Sun
programme.desc: 2023: Aegina, Greece: Lee Juggurnauth jets off to the Greek island of Aegina to help Marjory find the perfect holiday home that all her family can enjoy. She has chosen this island as it's just a ferry ride from her son and baby grandson, who live in Athens. With a budget of £150,000, Lee lines up five impressive options for her to consider

programme.title: A Place in the Sun
programme.desc: 2012: Murcia: Presenter Jasmine Harman has her work cut out as she tries to help Gordon Sandilands and his partner Louisa Hunter find a second home in Murcia, Spain for less than £100,000

programme.title: A Place in the Sun
programme.desc: 2015: Oliva: Sara Damergi goes house-hunting in Oliva, in Spain's Valencia region, hoping to find a suitable holiday home for keen cyclists Debbie and Graham from Portsmouth

programme.title: Grand Designs
programme.desc:
Lizard Peninsula, 2010: Kevin McCloud follows interior designer Kathryn Tyler as she tries to create a Scandinavian-style eco house in her mother's back garden in Falmouth, Cornwall, close by the Lizard Peninsula. The plan is ambitious, featuring a white-painted brick ground floor, a lightweight timber-frame first floor and cleverly designed spaces, but the small size of the plot and Kathryn's inexperience could hamper the project
S10E06

programme.title: Grand Designs: The Streets
programme.desc:
Tim plans to move from his small flat in Bicester into an architecturally daring home at the UK's largest mass self-build site in Graven Hill. With the help of his dad Michael, the project is supposed to be a chance to spend quality time together outside of work but the stress begins to ramp up when the five-tonne car lift Tim ordered from China doesn't fit into the specially prepared hole in the basement. Plus, Kevin and Natasha revisit Jitinder, whose house was unfinished due to the moisture problems and his resin floor last time they met, now they experience the full splendour of his Hollywood Hills style home
S03E02

programme.title: Sean Lock: Keep It Light
programme.desc: The 8 Out of 10 Cats Does Countdown captain captured live on stage in a stand-up performance, talking about everything from the price of cinema food, accusations of him having a mid-life crisis, his behaviour on the internet and jewellery heists

programme.title: 24 Hours in A&E
programme.desc:
Forty-nine-year-old Nasly is brought into A&E with DKA, a life-threatening complication of diabetes, and Charlie, 72, has severe chest and back pains, although his complicated medical history proves a challenge for the medics. Emergency nurse practitioner Alison is on a busy shift, while explaining how her parents' life in Iran, and the struggles they faced during the revolution, influenced her to get into medicine
S26E02

programme.title: Gogglebox
programme.desc:
The armchair critics share their opinions on what they have been watching during the week, with cameras capturing their instant reactions and the lively discussions that are prompted by the week's biggest and best shows
S21E14

programme.title: Gogglebox
programme.desc:
The armchair critics share their opinions on programmes including Love Is Blind, Starstruck, Cheaters, Celebrity Help! My House Is Haunted, Bradley & Barney Walsh: Breaking Dad, Teen First Dates and Sophie Raworth's Sunday Morning interview with Boris Johnson. Plus, an appraisal of the coverage of the coronavirus on BBC News
S19E02

programme.title: Taskmaster
programme.desc:
A Show About Pedantry: Contenders Frankie Boyle, Ivo Graham, Jenny Eclair, Kiell Smith-Bynoe and Mae Martin continue to address the challenges set for them by Greg Davies. It's nearly the end of the series, and the pressure is so intense that Mae immediately forgets the only rule to a task. Greg demands to be educated about history - but the five comics only seem to know about the year 1066. And there's paint, stomping, poor time-keeping and some impressively sneaky prizes in this quazi semi-final. As usual, Alex Horne helps maintain order
S15E09

programme.title: Naked Attraction
programme.desc:
Anna Richardson meets 34-year-old Skyla from Kent who runs her own cleaning business and is looking for Mr Right. Zeus, a 27-year-old trans man from Norwich, is new to the dating scene and is looking for someone special to go on this journey with him
S11E06

programme.title: Kirstie and Phil's Love It or List It: Brilliant Builds
programme.desc:
Brilliant Builds: Biggest Builds and Complete Overhauls: Kirstie Allsopp and Phil Spencer look back at two of their biggest builds. In Huddersfield, Paul and Dawn Welham-Campbell's higgledy-piggledy layout simply does not work for them any more. Kirstie gets the sledgehammer out, while Phil searches for properties to rival Paul and Dawn's own. In Woodford, east London, Keeley and Terrence Stamp are also at loggerheads. Keeley's fed up that their family of five is bursting out of their three bedrooms and one bathroom, and that their open plan lounge is basically one big noisy thoroughfare. Which of the property duo will come up with the best solution to their problems?
S02E05

programme.title: Find It, Fix It, Flog It
programme.desc:

programme.title: A Place in the Sun
programme.desc: 2012: Vero Beach, Florida: Jonnie Irwin travels to Vero Beach, Florida, to help Deborah and Stephen Price from Cardiff find their dream holiday home on the other side of the Atlantic on a budget of £80,000

programme.title: A Place in the Sun
programme.desc: 2022: Peloponnese: Property expert Lee Juggurnauth helps Sarah and Justin locate a suitable a holiday home on Greece's south-west Peloponnese peninsula. The couple met 35 years ago on the beach in Greece, and now with two grown-up daughters, think it's time to buy a property there. They have a budget of £320,000 to work within, so Lee sorts out a number of options for them to consider

programme.title: A Place in the Sun
programme.desc: 2021: Lucca, Tuscany: Michelle and Bernard from Bolton first visited the stunning Italian city of Lucca a year ago and immediately fell in love with its traditional Tuscan charm and beautiful countryside. The couple now want to buy a holiday home in a nearby town or village, which they can enjoy with their whole family. Helping to fulfil their dream is Ben Hillman, who lines up five options up for their £75,000 budget

programme.title: A Place in the Sun
programme.desc: 2020: Albufeira, Portugal: Rita and Stephen from Watford, Hertfordshire, have visited the lively Portuguese town of Albufeira over 40 times now and are finally looking to buy their own holiday home there. programme.title: Location, Location, Location

In the first episode, Reeva's parents Barry and June Steenkamp discuss her early life as they face fresh grief from the news that a parole process will put them in contact with Pistorius
S01E01

programme.title: My Name Is Reeva
programme.desc:
Reeva's father considers meeting Oscar Pistorius and experts examine witness testimonies from the night of her death

programme.title: My Name Is Reeva
programme.desc:
Barry Steenkamp confronts Oscar Pistorius and the family hope that hearing the truth about Reeva's death will bring them some peace

programme.desc:

programme.title: 24 Hours in A&E

programme.title: 24 Hours in A&E
programme.desc:
In an edition of the documentary focusing on fathers and sons, 51-year-old builder Rod is rushed into A&E after falling 18 feet from scaffolding onto concrete. When scans reveal that he has fractured some of his vertebrae and will require extensive surgery, his wife Nicky is left to call their two sons to prepare them for bad news. Meanwhile, 86-year-old retired policeman John is brought to St George's with a head injury after falling off a wall. As doctors assess the severity of the damage, he talks about how his career took over his life, so much so that he missed the birth of his son. programme.title: Come Dine with Me

programme.title: Come Dine with Me

programme.title: 60 Days on the Estates
programme.desc:
With more than one million households on England's social housing waiting list, according to Shelter England's social housing deficit campaign, filmmaker Ed Stafford moves into some of the UK's most troubled housing estates for 60 days and nights, to look beyond the tabloid headlines and experience first-hand the daily hardships that locals face. In this opening episode, Ed is in Northumberland Park, north London, where he meets a mum with three sets of twins under 11 who live in a one-bed council flat which has recurring damp. He also meets a 45-year-old resident who started smoking crack at 17 and now lives alone in a housing association flat

programme.title: The Way Back (2010)
programme.desc: Siberian gulag prisoners stage a daring escape during the Second World War. Refusing to live under Stalin's rule, they embark on a gruelling 4,500-mile journey across inhospitable terrain to escape the Soviet Union. Peter Weir's drama, starring Ed Harris, Colin Farrell, Saoirse Ronan, Jim Sturgess and Mark Strong

programme.title: 10 Things We Should Do Before We Break Up (2020)
programme.desc: A single mother-of-two becomes pregnant following a one-night stand with a committed bachelor, but the unlikely pair try to make a go of it. Romantic drama, starring Christina Ricci and Hamish Linklater

programme.title: Legend of the Demon Cat (2017)
programme.desc: More than a thousand years ago during the Tang Dynasty, a Chinese poet and a Japanese monk join forces to investigate a demonic cat that has possessed a general's wife. Fantasy mystery, starring Xuan Huang and Shota Sometani. in Mandarin and Japanese

programme.title: Street Fighter: The Legend of Chun-Li (2009)
programme.desc: A Chinese teenager puts her fighting skills into use battling an evil crime boss and his henchman, who took her father away years before and have been holding him prisoner all this time. Two cops investigating a series of murders in Bangkok are drawn into her fight for justice. Martial arts adventure based on the video game, with Kristin Kreuk and Neal McDonough

programme.title: Clara's Ghost (2018)
programme.desc: Clara Reynolds is fed up with constant badgering from her self-absorbed showbiz family and finds solace in - and guidance from - the supernatural force she believes is haunting her. Comedy thriller, starring Paula Niedert Elliott and Haley Joel Osment

programme.title: Inside Llewyn Davis (2013)
programme.desc: An aspiring musician struggles to make a name for himself in the Greenwich village folk scene of early 1960s New York. As he pursues an audition with an influential music mogul, he comes across a series of obstacles - many of his own making. The Coen brothers' drama, starring Oscar Isaac, Carey Mulligan, John Goodman and Justin Timberlake

programme.title: The Promise (2016)
programme.desc: During the Ottoman Empire, immediately before the Armenian Genocide, a love triangle develops between a gifted Armenian medical student, a Paris-based American journalist and an Armenian-born woman raised in France. Drama, starring Oscar Isaac, Charlotte Le Bon and Christian Bale

programme.title: The Last Station (2009)
programme.desc: A naive young man is appointed as the private secretary to the ageing Leo Tolstoy in 1910, but finds himself in the middle of a bitter conflict. The writer has embraced strong socialist and pacifist principles and wishes to leave everything to the people - but his wife does not want to give up his legacy. Period drama, with James McAvoy, Christopher Plummer and Helen Mirren

programme.title: Song for Marion (2012)
programme.desc: A grouchy old man has always been dismissive of his wife's role in the unconventional local choir. When she is diagnosed with a terminal illness and is no longer able to sing, he reluctantly agrees to take her place, a decision that dramatically changes his life and helps him through the hard times to come. Comedy drama, with Terence Stamp, Gemma Arterton, Vanessa Redgrave and Christopher Eccleston

programme.title: Chi-Raq (2015)
programme.desc: Spike Lee's dark comic drama with Nick Cannon. After a child is killed by a stray bullet, a group of women find a unique way to take on the violence in Chicago's Southside by withholding sex. Spike Lee's comedy crime drama, starring Nick Cannon

programme.title: Inside Llewyn Davis (2013)
programme.desc: An aspiring musician struggles to make a name for himself in the Greenwich village folk scene of early 1960s New York. The Coen brothers' drama, starring Oscar Isaac, Carey Mulligan, John Goodman and Justin Timberlake

programme.title: Infamous (2020)
programme.desc: Arielle is a social media-obsessed teenager who is saving money because she wants to get out of her small hometown in Florida. She falls in love with Dean, a mechanic who was once involved in an armed robbery. When Arielle realises her money has been stolen, she and Dean set off on a crime spree, uploading footage of their illegal activities for their growing fanbase. Drama, starring Bella Thorne, Jake Manley and Amber Riley
